byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

abstract: Federal Reserve and Office of the Comptroller of the Currency are planning to impose their own penalties on JPMorgan for questionable employment practices in China; bank is close to settling bribery investigation stemming from its hiring of children of Chinese officials in order to secure business with government-run companies; additional fines will come on top of $200 million JPMorgan is expected to pay federal prosecutors and Securities and Exchange Commission.

keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The bank’s top regulators are seeking to impose their own penalties in the China hiring case, according to people briefed on the investigations.
snippet: The bank’s top regulators are seeking to impose their own penalties in the China hiring case, according to people briefed on the investigations....

headline.main: JPMorgan May Face New Scrutiny in China Hiring Case
headline.print_headline: New Scrutiny for JPMorgan in China Hiring
